title: What I am realizing about ranked, and what every other bronze/silver/gold needs to realize too
body:
All you can do is make the best of every situation.

It all comes down to what you can do combat the enemies advances into winning the game, in every elo 98% of the time you are going to have losing lanes, it might be 1, 2 lanes, or 3 lanes, the lower the elo the more likely you can combat their advances, in high diamond if it is 6-0 by the 10 minute mark (adc and mid both have 3 kills) you could argue it is over, provided your jungle and top haven't fell too far behind or are on equal terms with opposing top laner/jungler. After this it all comes down to pushing a lead and playing sensibly, in high diamond this can be possible, though in some cases high diamond players might die unnecessarily, but it is far more of a common occurrence in lower elos.

The point I am trying to make is, every elo looks grim, but it is all down to what you can make of every situation and how quickly you adapt to your environment, always remember in lower elos there will be a stupid thing a player will do and it is all up to you to capitalize on that, if you make a lot of errors you need to pray to God that you aren't punished, and to be honest, in silver or bronze people will not get punished as much as they should. Think about it, in a silver 3 game there is a plat+ jungler, in this game the plat jungler will be more active in punishing stupid plays, they will continue to do so until the enemies nexus is destroyed or are very fed. 

Nearly every situation is different, so you need to learn how to play that situation right, and make the most out of it. (sometimes there isn't anything you can do)

TL;DR Elo hell isn't real

replies.body: Wise words. As for the tldr; I do agree that elo hell doesn't exist, but it completely depends on the time frame on what elo hell is classified as If you're stuck in that elo for a month+ then yes elo hell would not count as an excuse. However, if you a player is struggling in a division for a couple of days, then an excuse such as this might be made (if LP gains are low or you are just having a streak of really terrible players) Although I would not exactly use the phrase 'elo hell' to describe this, but I do think players can be stuck in a division for a few days or weeks and still have the right skill level to progress higher. Any more time than that however, and the notion seems less believable.
